title: What are some of the common steps that occur when using critical thinking for problem solving? - Quora

response.answer_text: The absolute first step in applying critical thinking to any problem is to assume the position that you don’t know what the problem is. “ But,” you say, “i know what the problem is.” And therein lies the problem. You think you know what the problem is, set about solving THAT problem, and the solution doesn’t work, because THAT wasn’t the problem. We fail to solve problems, not because we don’t know how, but because we don’t know what the real problem is. The beginning and sine qua non of critical thinking is realizing you don’t know. That’s why there’s so little critical thinking going on.
